The plan is for virtual instruction for all students beginning September 8 and continuing through the end of the first semester in January. As we get closer to the end of the first semester, the board will use updated information regarding the COVID-19 pandemic to determine whether students will return to face-to-face instruction or if we will continue with virtual instruction.

We greatly appreciate your patience and support as we navigate these unchartered waters.

Are you a rising sophomore or junior interested in further developing your leadership skills? If so, the Junior Leadership Florence County Program is seeking your application by March 15th.

To be eligible to apply:
1. Students must be classified as high school sophomores or juniors during the 2020-21 school year.

2. The program is open to public, private and home schooled students who live and/or attend school in Florence County.

3. Students must be in good academic standing with their school and must have a written endorsement from their high school principal or guidance counselor as well as support of their parent/guardian.

Applications available at: https://www.jrleadershipflorencecounty.com/

Florence School District 3 will hold a teacher recruitment fair Saturday, February 8, from 10 a.m.-1:30 p.m. in The Stables Building located at the Inn at the Crossroads.

Interviews will be conducted on-site for the following positions: secondary (English, math, science & social studies), middle level (English, math, science & social studies), elementary, early childhood, special education, art, music, physical education, foreign language (Spanish), guidance, CTE and library media.

Anyone interested in participating can register at https://fsd3recruitmentfair2020.eventbrite.com/. The deadline to register is February 3.

The application window for students interested in attending J. Paul Truluck Creative Arts and Science Magnet School or Olanta Creative Arts and Science Magnet School opens Tuesday, January 21, at 6 p.m. and will close at 11:59 p.m. on Friday February 7. A link to the online application will be posted on the district website and Facebook page on January 21.

Students and parents interested in learning more about the educational opportunities offered at the two schools are invited to attend the Magnet School Showcase on Tuesday, January 21, at 6 p.m. at both schools. Parents attending the showcase at either school will have the opportunity to complete the online application while there.

For more information, contact J. Paul Truluck Creative Arts and Science Magnet School at 843-374-8685 or Olanta Creative Arts and Science Magnet School at 843-396-4457.

The online application goes live Tuesday, January 21, at 6:30 p.m. at https://florence3.novuschoice.com/. Applications will not be accepted before that time.
